titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives relating to the eradication of slavery where it exists throughout the world.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to the Subcommittee on International Security, International Organizations and Human Rights.

committee.name: House Foreign Affairs
committee.subcommittee: International Security, International Organizations, and Human Rights

bill.summary: 10/6/1994--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that: (1) the Secretary of State should include a full report on slavery where it exists throughout the world in the annual human rights report; (2) the U.S. Government should work with regional organizations and appropriate United Nations organizations to draw up a multinational plan to put an end to slavery; and (3) the eradication of slavery should be an important goal of the Government in all of its activities.
